title: Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani
ingredients: 500g chicken (marinated in yogurt, chili, and biryani masala)
Whole spices (bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom)
Saffron milk + mint + coriander for layering
instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes, then cook until 70% done.
Fry onions until golden brown and set aside.
Cook marinated chicken until almost done.
In a pot, layer rice and chicken alternately.
Top with saffron milk, fried onions, mint, and coriander.
Seal with lid and cook on low flame for 20 minutes (dum).

title: Royyala Vepudu (Prawn Fry)
instructions: Clean prawns and marinate with turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt.
Heat oil in a pan, add curry leaves.
Add marinated prawns and cook on high heat.
Stir occasionally until prawns are cooked and slightly crispy.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

title: Bobbatlu (Puran Poli)
ingredients: For outer covering: 2 cups maida, 1/4 cup oil, salt, water
For filling: 1 cup chana dal, 1 cup jaggery, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 2 tbsp ghee
instructions: Cook chana dal until soft, drain and grind to paste.
Heat ghee, add dal paste and jaggery. Cook until thick.
Add cardamom powder and cool the filling.
Make soft dough with maida, oil, salt, and water.
Divide dough and filling into equal portions.
Roll dough, place filling, seal edges, and roll again.
Cook on tawa with ghee until golden brown on both sides.

title: Chepa Pulusu (Fish Curry)
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add all spice powders and cook until oil separates.
Add tamarind pulp and water, bring to boil.
Add fish pieces and cook until fish is tender.
Garnish with curry leaves and coriander leaves.
